content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice clash, here is my solution in python:
recipe_length = int(input())
storage_space = int(input())
queue_length = int(input())

recipe = [*range(recipe_length)]
storage = []
cakes = 0

for i in input().split():
    ingredient = int(i)
    storage.append(ingredient)
    if all(ingredient in storage for ingredient in recipe):
        for ingredient in recipe: storage.remove(ingredient)
        cakes += 1

    if (len(storage) >= storage_space): break

print(cakes)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good one

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun and challenging problem to solve. I also like the concise description.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

First, I think it's a good one.
But I also think the wording is a bit confusing and could be simplified. 

Example: 
recipeLength :  Number of unique ingredients types for this recipe
ingredientQueue : Space-separated list of incoming ingredients types.

Hi everyone! First time contributing -- open to feedback on any aspect of the puzzle.

(In particular: if the puzzle seems too complex for a Clash, one option would be to have recipeLength be a constant, e.g. always 5.)

Very nice for a first contribution!

The difficulty seemed just fine to me.

The input field should only be used to describe the type of data you are reading.
You should instead use the statement field to describe how the puzzle works.

There is a typo in your stub input, it should be 
loopline recipeLength ingredient:int
Don't forget to populate the constraints field as well.

I think the statement  "The machine stops as soon as there is not enough space to store a new arrival." is a bit misleading since from what I've seen in my solution the machine actually tries to bake a cake first, and only stops if it could not. I think the statement implies the machine will stop without trying to bake a cake, but perhaps that's just because my English is not that good ^^".

Also, it is implied, but maybe for the sake of clarity you should specify that all the given ingredients are in the recipe (ie there are no useless ingredients) since it was not obvious to me the first time I read the statement.

Otherwise a very good start.
Thanks! I updated those and made some other changes. (Further suggestions very welcome.)

Thanks!

I reformatted the statement with your suggestions. Thanks in particular for noting the ambiguity about when the machine stops.

I believe that the stub input is correct: the default code should read however many [[ingredient]]s are in [[ingredientQueue]], which isn't related to [[recipeLength]]. Is the input failing in your language?

Oh wow. I'll remember to check the stub in a few languages in the future. Fixed, thanks!

I'll leave this as WIP for another week or so, to see if anyone else has ideas.
